intro: Agalinis manglaris, commonly known as the mangrove agalinis, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is adapted to saline and tidal environments. The plant has slender, branched stems and produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Agalinis manglaris plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial organisms.
